qas.question: What is the span of years of the Middle Triassic?
What continuing event began in the Middle Triassic?
During the breakup of Pangaea, what sea was created?
From what had the ecosystem had to recover?
What type of animal began to flourish and become increasingly large?
What continuing event ended in the Middle Triassic?
In what period did pine forests mostly die out?
During the formation of Pangaea, what sea was created?
Pine forests brought about the demise of what insects?

context: The Middle Triassic spans from <a0_0>247 million to 237 million<a0_0/> years ago. The <b6_0>Middle Triassic<b6_0/> featured the beginnings of the <a1_0><b5_0>breakup of Pangaea<b5_0/><a1_0/>, and the beginning of the <a2_0><b7_0>Tethys Sea<b7_0/><a2_0/>. The ecosystem had recovered from the devastation that was <a3_0>the Great Dying<a3_0/>. Phytoplankton, coral, and crustaceans all had recovered, and the <a4_0>reptiles<a4_0/> began to get bigger and bigger. New aquatic reptiles evolved such as Ichthyosaurs and Nothosaurs. Meanwhile, on land, Pine forests flourished, bringing along <b8_0>mosquitoes and fruit flies<b8_0/>. The first ancient crocodilians evolved, which sparked competition with the large amphibians that had since ruled the freshwater world.
